name: aggregationColumn
description: The column to aggregate. Can be a derived metric.

name: aggregationFunction
description: The aggregation function to apply on the aggregationColumn. Example: `AVG`.

name: aggregationParameter
description: The second argument of the aggregationFunction. Example: for `PERCENTILETDIGEST`: `95`.

name: completenessDelay
description: The time for your data to be considered complete and ready for anomaly detection. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `PT2H`. [Learn more](https://dev.startree.ai/docs/startree-enterprise-edition/startree-thirdeye/concepts/alert-configuration#completenessdelay).

name: dataset
description: The dataset to query.

name: dataSource
description: The Pinot datasource to use.

name: dayHoursOfWeek
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen at specific time periods. A mapping of `{DAY: [hours]}`. Anomalies happening on these timeframes are ignored if timeOfWeekIgnore is true. Example: `{"FRIDAY": [22, 23], "SATURDAY": [0, 1, 2]}`

name: daysOfWeek
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen at specific time periods. A list of days. Anomalies happening on these days are ignored if timeOfWeekIgnore is true. Example: `["MONDAY", "SUNDAY"]`.

name: eventFilterAfterEventMargin
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen during events. Same as eventFilterBeforeEventMargin at the end of the event.

name: eventFilterBeforeEventMargin
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen during events. A period in ISO-8601 format that corresponds to a period that is also impacted by the event. Example: if beforeEventMargin is `P1D`, if event happens on `[Dec 24 0:00, Dec 25 0:00[`, the label will be applied to anomalies happening on `[Dec 23 0:00 and Dec 25 0:00[`

name: eventFilterLookaround
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen during events. Offset to apply on startTime and endTime to look around the timeframe. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `P1D`.

name: eventFilterSqlFilter
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen during events. Sql filter to apply on the events. [Learn more](https://dev.startree.ai/docs/startree-enterprise-edition/startree-thirdeye/reference/operators/event-fetcher#sql-filter)

name: eventFilterTypes
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen during events. List of event types to fetch by. Example: `["HOLIDAY", "DEPLOYMENT"]`. `[]` fetches all events. Use `["__NO_EVENTS"]` to disable.

name: guardrailMetric
description: Used to ignore anomalies that don't meet the guardrail threshold. Metric to use as a threshold guardrail. Example: `COUNT(*)` and set `guardrailMetricMin = 100` to ignore anomalies detected when there is less than 100 observations in the period.

name: guardrailMetricMax
description: Used to ignore anomalies that don't meet the guardrail threshold. Maximum threshold of guardrailMetric. If `-1`, no maximum threshold is applied.

name: guardrailMetricMin
description: Used to ignore anomalies that don't meet the guardrail threshold. Minimum threshold of the guardrail metric. If `-1`, no minimum threshold is applied.

name: hoursOfDay
description: Used to ignore anomalies that happen at specific time periods. A list of hours. Anomalies happening on these hours are ignored. Example: `[0,1,2,23]`

name: impactComputationMethod
description: Method to compute the impact.

name: impactThreshold
description: Used to ignore anomalies that don't meet the impact threshold. Impact filter threshold.

name: impactWindow
description: Period to compute the impact. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `PT4H`

name: lookback
description: Historical time period to use to train the model. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `P21D`.

name: mergeMaxDuration
description: Maximum gap between 2 anomalies for anomalies to be merged. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `PT2H`. To disable anomalies merging, set this value to `P0D`.

name: mergeMaxGap
description: Maximum duration of an anomaly merger. At merge time, if an anomaly merger would get bigger than this limit, the anomalies are not merged. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `P7D`.

name: monitoringGranularity
description: The period of aggregation of the timeseries. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `PT1H`.

name: mutabilityPeriod
description: Use if your data is mutable. ThirdEye will maintain the detection results up to date on the mutable period. For instance, if your last 10 days of data is mutable, set `P10D`. At each cron detection job, the detection results for the last 10 days will be updated.

name: pattern
description: Whether to detect an anomaly if it's a drop, a spike or any of the two.

name: queryFilters
description: Filters to apply when fetching data. Prefix with `AND`. Example: `AND country='US'`

name: queryLimit
description: Maximum number of timeseries point to fetch.

name: rcaAggregationFunction
description: The aggregation function to use for RCA. If the detection metric name is known to ThirdEye, this parameter is optional.

name: rcaEventSqlFilter
description: A Sql filter for RCA events. Only events that match the filter will be shown in the RCA related events tab. [Learn more](https://dev.startree.ai/docs/startree-enterprise-edition/startree-thirdeye/concepts/alert-configuration#sqlfilter).

name: rcaEventTypes
description: A list of type to filter on for RCA. Only events that match such types will be shown in the RCA related events tab. [Learn more](https://dev.startree.ai/docs/startree-enterprise-edition/startree-thirdeye/concepts/alert-configuration#types).

name: rcaExcludedDimensions
description: List of dimensions (columns in the dataset) to ignore in RCA drill-downs. If not set or empty, all dimensions of the table are used. rcaExcludedDimensions and rcaIncludedDimensions cannot be used at the same time.

name: rcaIncludedDimensions
description: List of the dimensions (columns in the dataset) to use in RCA drill-downs. If not set or empty, all dimensions of the table are used. [Learn more](https://dev.startree.ai/docs/startree-enterprise-edition/startree-thirdeye/concepts/alert-configuration#dimensions).

name: replayReNotifyPercentageThreshold
description:
Used for replay when data is mutable. Avoid being renotified by small variations caused by data mutability when a detection is replayed. At replay, if the percentage difference between an existing anomaly and a new anomaly on the same time frame is above this threshold, the new anomaly is notified. Else, it is not notified. 
Combined with replayReNotifyAbsoluteThreshold.
 Both thresholds have to pass to get renotified.
  If zero, always renotify. If null or negative, never renotifies.

name: replayReNotifyAbsoluteThreshold
description:
Used for replay when data is mutable. Avoid being renotified by small variations caused by data mutability when a detection is replayed. At replay, if the absolute difference between an existing anomaly and a new anomaly on the same time frame is above this threshold, the new anomaly is notified. Else, it is not notified. 
Combined with replayReNotifyPercentageThreshold.
 Both thresholds have to pass to be renotified.
  If zero, always renotify. If null or negative, never renotifies.

name: seasonalityPeriod
description: Biggest seasonality period to learn. In ISO-8601 format. Example: `P7D`.

name: sensitivity
description: The sensitivity of the model. The smaller, the less anomaly are detected.

name: thresholdFilterMax
description: Used to ignore anomalies that don't meet the thresholdFilter min and max. Example: set `thresholdFilterMin = 10` to ignore anomalies when the metric is smaller than 10. Can help ignore anomalies happening in low data regimes. Filter threshold maximum. If `-1`, no maximum threshold is applied.

name: thresholdFilterMin
description: Used to ignore anomalies that don't meet the thresholdFilter min and max. Example: set `thresholdFilterMin = 10` to ignore anomalies when the metric is smaller than 10. Can help ignore anomalies happening in low data regimes. Filter threshold minimum. If `-1`, no minimum threshold is applied.

name: timeColumn
description: TimeColumn used to group by time. If set to AUTO (the default value), the Pinot primary time column is used.

name: timeColumnFormat
description: Required if timeColumn is not AUTO. [Learn more](https://dev.startree.ai/docs/startree-enterprise-edition/startree-thirdeye/reference/operators/data-fetcher#timeformat-strings).

name: timezone
description: Timezone used to group by time.
